Field Detail

ZERONODETREES

protected static final RECKCTTreeNodeImpl[] ZERONODETREES
A leaf node should have a zero-length array for its children. For efficiency, subclasses can use this array as a return value for children() for leaf nodes if desired. Should this be public instead?

setChildren

public void setChildren(edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree[] children)
Sets the children of this Tree. If given null, this method prints a warning and sets the Tree's children to the canonical zero-length Tree[] array. Constructing a LabeledScoredTreeLeaf is preferable in this case.

Overrides:
setChildren in class edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree
Parameters:
children - An array of child trees

removeLeftChildren

public void removeLeftChildren(int i)
Destructively removes all the children from the left the index i Note that this method will throw an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is too big for the list of daughters.

Parameters:
i - The daughter index

removeRightChildren

public void removeRightChildren(int i)
Destructively removes all the children from the index i to the right Note that this method will throw an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is too big for the list of daughters.

Parameters:
i - The daughter index

treeFactory

public edu.stanford.nlp.trees.TreeFactory treeFactory()
Return a TreeFactory that produces trees of the same type as the current Tree. That is, this implementation, will produce trees of type LabeledScoredTree(Node|Leaf). The Label of this is examined, and providing it is not null, a LabelFactory which will produce that kind of Label is supplied to the TreeFactory. If the Label is null, a StringLabelFactory will be used. The factories returned on different calls a different: a new one is allocated each time.

Specified by:
treeFactory in class edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree
Returns:
a factory to produce labeled, scored trees

factory

public static edu.stanford.nlp.trees.TreeFactory factory()
Return a TreeFactory that produces trees of the LabeledScoredTree{Node|Leaf} type. The factory returned is always the same one (a singleton).

Returns:
a factory to produce labeled, scored trees

factory

public static edu.stanford.nlp.trees.TreeFactory factory(edu.stanford.nlp.ling.LabelFactory lf)
Return a TreeFactory that produces trees of the LabeledScoredTree{Node|Leaf} type, with the Label made with the supplied LabelFactory. The factory returned is a different one each time

Parameters:
lf - The LabelFactory to use
Returns:
a factory to produce labeled, scored trees

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
Implements equality for Tree's. Two Tree objects are equal if they have equal Labels, the same number of children, and their children are pairwise equal.

Specified by:
equals in interface java.util.Collection<edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree>
Overrides:
equals in class edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree
Parameters:
o - The object to compare with
Returns:
Whether two things are equal

subTrees

public java.util.Set<edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree> subTrees()
Get the set of all subtrees inside the tree by returning a tree rooted at each node. These are not copies, but all share structure. The tree is regarded as a subtree of itself.

Note: If you only want to form this Set so that you can iterate over it, it is more efficient to simply use the Tree class's own iterator() method. This will iterate over the exact same elements (but perhaps/probably in a different order).

Overrides:
subTrees in class edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree
Returns:
the Set of all subtrees in the tree.

subTreeList

public java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree> subTreeList()
Get the list of all subtrees inside the tree by returning a tree rooted at each node. These are not copies, but all share structure. The tree is regarded as a subtree of itself.

Note: If you only want to form this Collection so that you can iterate over it, it is more efficient to simply use the Tree class's own iterator() method. This will iterate over the exact same elements (but perhaps/probably in a different order).

Overrides:
subTreeList in class edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree
Returns:
the List of all subtrees in the tree.

subTrees

public java.util.Collection<edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree> subTrees(java.util.Collection<edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree> n)
Add the set of all subtrees inside a tree (including the tree itself) to the given Collection.

Note: If you only want to form this Collection so that you can iterate over it, it is more efficient to simply use the Tree class's own iterator() method. This will iterate over the exact same elements (but perhaps/probably in a different order).

Overrides:
subTrees in class edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree
Parameters:
n - A collection of nodes to which the subtrees will be added.
Returns:
The collection parameter with the subtrees added.

parent

public RECKCTTreeNodeImpl parent(RECKCTTreeNodeImpl root)
Return the parent of the tree node. This routine will traverse a tree (depth first) from the given root, and will correctly find the parent, regardless of whether the concrete class stores parents. It will only return null if this node is the root node, or if this node is not contained within the tree rooted at root.

Parameters:
root - The root node of the whole Tree
Returns:
the parent Tree node if any; else null
